text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Sudanese president receives envoy from President Saddam Hussein
- Iraqi Deputy Prime Minister Tareq Aziz arrives in Moscow
- In a move to cover its responsibility, Washington blames United Nations for delay in arrival of food and medical supplies to Iraq
- Yemeni president urges Saudi Arabia to work for lifting sanctions on Iraq
- Vice-Chairman of Revolutionary Command Council Izzat Ibrahim attacks Washington
- (The above were also carried by AL-IRAQ and JUMHOURIYA)
- Commentary attacks U.N. arms envoy for misleading statements on Iraq
- Article says United States leads the world in crime incidence
- Iraq and Malta review means they to resume bilateral trade
- Editorial slams Ekeus for anti-Iraq statements
